HI EVRYBODY!!! I know how to use The Rosetta Stone language program...You need first a installer disc,you find it her on pirat bay...Just search under "The Rosetta Stone",you will find it!Then you must open it in a program like ultraiso,you get it on the net just search for it...Well now it is open the iso file you donloade her on pirat bay.Just click on setup exe,and it will install it on your computer...

Now part 2! Now you finish downloading the language file like her Thai,you open a program like Nero burning rom,and you use burn image to cd function.Now just import the iso file and burn it to cd-r about 80 min 700MB in size...Now you are ready: open the Rosetta Stone language pogram,and put the disc in to you pc and click search and it will find the language fils ! The rest is easy,enjoy whit learning Thai esy way... with out the installer disc you cannot use it at all!!!

For those who don't know how to get their language packs added. 

This may not be the L337 way to do it, but mine works fine and this is how I added it.


1. Download a program such as MagicISO, PowerISO, DaemonTools, etc.

2. Install a virtual cd drive. This can be done by right clicking an iso file, going to MagicISO(or whatever you installed), and choosing the appropriate option to add a driver.

3. Once you have a virtual driver, right click the iso, go to your virtual driver, and "mount"

4.If you installed Rosetta Stone properly, which can be tricky depending on your download, open it up and add the language from there.

These language packs are for v.2 Rosetta Stone. If you have the updated v.3, they won't work. Unfortunately I couldn't find any v.3 Thai .iso, so I had to download a complete language pack with like 25 languages just to get Thai. You may need to do the same if you're running v.3.
